title: Graphic & Print Design Manager
company_info: We are here to inspire parents to cherish every bonding moment while nurturing their child’s full potential. From our humble beginning in 2017, we have been putting our faith in the magic of parent-child bonding moments. KeaBabies, under our parent company KeaWorld, is now simplifying the lives of over 2.5 million parents in 13 countries. We are well on our way towards an ecosystem that offers a wide range of award-winning and internationally certified baby and maternity products.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Graphic & Print Design Manager at KeaBabies leads the design team in creating innovative visual materials, print designs, and color palettes for textile products and hardlines for baby and maternity products. This role oversees the end-to-end design process, collaborates with cross-functional teams, and ensures brand consistency. Focused on Western markets, particularly the USA and Canada, the manager stays aligned with market trends, seasons, and customer preferences while adhering to budgets and timelines.
Main Responsibilities:
1. Design Leadership and Strategy:
Lead the remote design team in producing high-quality prints, color palettes, graphics, and illustrations aligned with the brand's vision.
Apply design thinking to develop customer-centric designs, color schemes, and print patterns.
Formulate a data-driven design strategy that aligns with Western market trends and business objectives.
2. Collaboration and Efficiency:
Collaborate closely with product sourcing and procurement teams to select materials and suppliers for design variations.
Ensure cost-effective and quality-driven sourcing decisions while preserving design integrity.
3. Brand Consistency and Presentation:
Maintain brand consistency across all visual elements.
Effectively communicate and present design concepts and ideas to cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communications, or related field.
Proven experience in graphic and print design, ideally in the baby and maternity lifestyle industry.
Leadership experience managing design teams and projects.
Strong design portfolio showcasing customer-centric designs, color palettes, and print patterns.
Proficiency in design software (e.g., Adobe Creative Suite).
Familiarity with design thinking.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Adaptability in fast-paced environments.
Passion for the brand's mission and baby/maternity products.
As the Graphic & Print Design Manager, you will shape the visual identity of a leading baby and maternity lifestyle brand in Western markets. Your contributions will play a pivotal role in KeaBabies' success by delivering exceptional designs and color palettes that resonate with customers and enhance product offerings.

title: Intern - Graphic Designer (Design & Content Marketing)
company_info: BHG Singapore - a leading lifestyle department store in Singapore has become synonymous with quality, value and service. It currently commands two stores island–wide, strategically located at Bugis Junction and Bishan Junction 8. The department store was established in 1994 as Seiyu Wing On Department Store under a joint venture between Seiyu, Ltd (Japan) and Wing On Pte Ltd (Hong Kong). It was acquired by Beijing Hualian Group in 2007 and has since operated under the brand name BHG. Beijing Hualian Group is one of the largest commercial chain retailers in China and operates numerous supermarkets, department stores and shopping malls in various provinces and cities. Backed by a myriad of local and international experience in the retailing business, BHG is set to take consumers on a shopping experience that is truly unique and memorable. It aims to become the most preferred department store for consumers in Singapore.

title: Graphic Designer
company: WORDS WORTH MEDIA MANAGEMENT PTE LTD
company_info: WORDS WORTH MEDIA MANAGEMENT PTE LTD Words Worth Media is an integrated agency established in 1991. It comprises three core divisions: branding and communications; content, production & activations; and digital marketing & strategy. Each division has its own specialization, but Words Worth Media as a whole is greater than the sum of its parts.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Design, Marketing / Public Relations, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The role

The Graphic Designer is responsible for the visual creation of campaigns and creatives of all scale, for online, print, video and collateral material.

The role includes establishing the conceptual and stylistic direction for clients’ projects and orchestrating the work of fellow designers, artists, photographers, illustrators, printers and anyone else involved in the development of a project.

The Graphic Designer must have the imagination, drive and enthusiasm for producing industry-leading and strategically sound work. They must be able to articulate their vision to internal stakeholders and clients.

Responsibilities
Comprehend communication strategies through creative briefings, and work closely with the Copywriters to generate innovative ideas and concepts to fulfil clients’ brief.
Creation and implementation of the visual design elements associated with brand positioning, public relations and strategic marketing for conveying clients’ unique message.
Act as the main force of visual execution and be responsible for quality control.
Produce sketches and storyboards (TV/video) and mock-ups (online/print) to communicate ideas to the clients.
Pitch ideas to Account Manager and internal stakeholders, as well as to clients.
Brief other members of the team.
Commission and brief photographers, artists or filmmakers to work on projects.
Visit and assess locations for potential shoots, and work on location.
Ability to maximise the financial resources and earnings of both clients and company.
Help fellow designers become familiar with the qualities of commercial art and enhance their creative thinking and abilities.
Be passionate about social media, new platforms and emerging tech, share helpful information with colleagues, and provide inspiring creative ideas for works.
Take responsibility and keep commitments when facing challenges or deadlines.
Required Skills & Preferred Qualifications
Minimum 2 years of experience in regional/global creative agencies.
Proficiency in mainstream design software.
Impressive portfolio with works able to demonstrate how to solve people/clients problems.
Impeccable attention to detail and organisational skills.
Great communicator and collaborator.
Forward thinking, and have an intellectual curiosity about what’s new in innovation, tech and platforms.
Passion for the work and dedication to craft.

title: Graphic Designer
company_info: The story of Bacha Coffee begins in the medina of Marrakech, Morocco. Built in 1910, the spectacular Dar el Bacha palace, which means “house of the Pasha”, united the greatest cultural and political minds of the century over glittering pots of “coffee of Arabia” or Arabica, as it is known today. Being the finest luxury coffee brand in the world, Bacha Coffee specialises in 100% Arabica coffees and provides customers with a unique opportunity to travel the world through their cup by exploring harvests from over 30 of the most well-reputed coffee producing countries. Even our distinctive fine blended, fine flavoured and naturally decaffeinated coffees are produced using only 100% Arabica beans to give coffee lovers the widest choice, without ever sacrificing quality or flavour.

title: Senior Graphic Designer
company_info: HOL helps brands create transformational experiences and build vibrant communities by: 1) strategising user-centric brand experiences 2) humanizing your brand and telling your stories emotively 3) providing sophisticated creative and art directions
address: WORK PLUS STORE SPAZE, 202 KALLANG BAHRU 339339
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About you:
You are a highly creative, intuitive, resourceful and motivated person with good sense of aesthetics as well as keen eye for visual details. You have the ability and capability to visualise and create high quality digital and print designs that bring to life the experiences that meet business goals. Your responsibilities include formulating creative ideas, managing all graphic design tasks, and refining drafts and final artworks. As a senior graphic designer, you have extensive knowledge and are aware of current design trends, styles, tools and techniques. You are always on hand to identify and create best designs for projects, and to provide solutions to all creative assets. The Senior Graphic Designer will work closely with the Creative Lead to design, coordinate and integrate exhibits, graphics and media concepts into the overall needs of the physical, digital or phygital platforms.

What will you be doing?
• Managing graphic designs from conception to delivery.
• Contributing creative, innovative and new ideas and approaches.
• Designing graphic content, illustrations, and infographics.
• Maintaining workflow in accordance with project schedule, with a variety of projects, tasks and deadlines. − Manage a team of designers, and delegate tasks to junior team members, and guide the design process to achieve project goals.
• Managing and reviewing the works of junior designer and to guide them towards achieving project goals and timelines.
• Ensuring brand consistency throughout various client projects.
• Working in a dynamic team environment that includes our internal team, clients, external partners, and other collaborators.
• Keeping up-to-date with industry developments.

What are we looking for?
• Diploma or B.A. in Graphic Design with ideally Environmental / Spatial Graphics experience with a minimum of 5 years of experience in exhibit graphic design or related field − High level of fluency with Adobe CS Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign), MS Office (AutoCAD and 3D modelling is a plus).
• Proven experience in multiple phases of the design process, including conceptualisation, design development, CD/FA and fabrication/installation process.
• Excellent typography and layout knowledge.
• Ability to meet tight deadlines whilst not compromising on quality.
• Impeccable eye for detail.
• Good communication skills.
• Proactive with a positive, can-do mindset.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced and collaborative environment.
• Passion for experience design.
• Knowledge of photography, animation and video production is a plus.

title: Marketing Coordinator cum Graphic Designer
company_info: DUKE BAKERY PTE. LTD. The bakery prides itself in the creation of exquisite handcrafted breads using only the finest quality ingredients from Europe. The first outlet in Singapore opened its doors on 27 October 2013 to rousing response. Following the success of the store, Duke Bakery has continued to serve even more customers with a subsequent additional outlets.
address: LIM CHEE GUAN FOOD INDUSTRIES, 230 PANDAN LOOP 128415
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Marketing & Coordination :
· Daily coordination within team and inter company functions to ensure marketing campaigns are well-executed on time and all relevant teams are updated. 团队内部和公司内部职能部门的日常协调，以确保营销活动按时顺利执行，并更新所有相关团队的信息。
· Design and adapt graphic designs, posters, flyers and other company collaterals for online usage and offline in-store promptly. 设计和调整图形设计、海报、传单和其他公司宣传品，以便在线和线下店内及时使用。
· Manage and ensure the company's website is consistently updated with accurate information, up-to-date content, and a seamless user experience. 管理并确保公司网站持续更新，提供准确的信息、最新的内容和无缝的用户体验。
· Take charge of the company's digital / social media accounts (Facebook, Instagram, WeChat, TikTok, Google Business, etc.), including execution of posting captivating and on-brand photos, stories, and promotions to engage our audience and community. 负责公司的电子/社交媒体帐户（Facebook、Instagram、WeChat、TikTok、Google Business等等），包括发布引人入胜的品牌照片、故事和促销活动，以吸引我们的受众和社区。
· Engage with customers via our digital platforms by promptly sharing tagged videos and stories, and promptly responding to inquiries, reviews, comments and feedback through email, Facebook, Instagram, TikTok and Google Business. 通过我们的电子平台与客户互动，及时分享标记的视频和故事，并通过电子邮件、Facebook、Instagram、TikTok 和 Google Business 及时回复查询、评论、评论和反馈。
· Maintain and follow up collaboration opportunities with partners to expand our brand presence and reach new audiences. 维护并跟进与合作伙伴的合作机会，以扩大我们的品牌影响力并吸引新受众。
· Manage and invite influencers for food tasting events, establishing successful relationships and leveraging their reach to generate brand awareness. 管理并邀请有影响力的人士参加美食品尝活动，建立成功的关系并利用他们的影响力来提高品牌知名度。
· Utilize advertising strategies based on the team's direction to boost advertisements, maximizing reach and engagement with our target audience. 根据团队的方向利用广告策略来增加广告，最大限度地扩大目标受众的覆盖面和参与度。
· Generate innovative ideas for yearly planning & monthly promotions that captivate our audience and contribute to increased sales. 为年度计划和每月的促销活动提出创新想法，吸引受众并有助于增加销售额。

Graphic Designer/Digital Designer Responsibilities:
· Conceptualize and design visually appealing graphics for print and digital media, including promotional materials, social media graphics, and presentations based on team’s direction and brief. 根据团队的方向和简介，为印刷和数字媒体构思和设计具有视觉吸引力的图形，包括宣传材料、社交媒体图形和演示文稿。
· Capture high-quality photographs and videos during events or for promotional purposes, and edit and enhance them for impactful content. 在活动期间或出于促销目的拍摄高质量的照片和视频，并对其进行编辑和增强以形成有影响力的内容。
· Designing, producing, and managing interactive online content, including email templates, social media, and promotional artwork, and informative ebooks. 设计、制作和管理交互式在线内容，包括电子邮件模板、社交媒体、宣传艺术品以及内容丰富的电子书。
· Preparing briefs for each project and presenting design ideas to all the relevant stakeholders. 为每个项目准备简介并向所有相关利益相关者展示设计理念。
· Collaborating with the e-commerce and marketing teams to ensure that all designs align with the brand image, while also meeting usability and website standards. 与电子商务和营销团队合作，确保所有设计符合品牌形象，同时满足可用性和网站标准。
· Ensuring consistency in designs and content across all company platforms. 确保所有公司平台的设计和内容的一致性。

title: Creative Designer
company_info: Secretlab was established in 2014 with the mission of creating the ultimate seating experience. We design and produce chairs for comfort over long hours of use in front of the computer. Our award-winning products have consistently achieved near perfect scores from both media and users. Secretlab products are sold directly to the customer, and are currently available in Singapore(where we are headquartered), US, UK, Malaysia, Australia, Canada, and most European & South-east Asia countries. Secretlab was the winner of OCBC’s Emerging Enterprise Award 2017. At Secretlab we are a team of highly motivated individuals that take great pride in our work. We are looking for driven, versatile, and result-oriented individuals who share our vision. You will be heavily involved in a fast-growing enterprise and be a part of the team that pioneers its rapid expansion. We offer great flexibility and plenty of opportunities for fast track careers to our staff.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Secretlab is an international gaming chair brand seating over a million users worldwide, with our key markets in the United States, Europe and Singapore, where we are headquartered.
As a valued member in our Creative team under the Comms Team umbrella, you will be supporting the team in achieving our ultimate goal of pushing out visually stunning creatives that reach a global audience. You'll work alongside a talented team of creatives with diverse specialties, including 3D motion designers, photo, and video specialists to bring your creative vision to life.
Working within the wider Marketing team, you’ll collaborate with various working-level stakeholders to ensure that all creatives align with the company's brand and messaging.
Our Creative team is responsible for all of Secretlab's content as well as our collaborative efforts with world-renowned brands, including Game of Thrones, Batman, Cloud9, Team Secret, as well as international esports organizers such as Riot Games for their League of Legends global tournaments.

Responsibilities
Conceptualize and execute the visual direction for launches and take full responsibility from concept to final design execution with excellence together with our Art Directors, Creative Director and Project Managers.
Proposing creative solutions to marketing briefs for product launches, seasonal sales and day to day marketing collateral in accordance with Secretlab’s branding across multiple social media platforms.
Actively collaborate with teams both within and outside the Visual team to understand project goals to effectively communicate messaging and meet business objectives.
Present design work to Art Directors and Creative Director and provide clear rationale behind design decisions.
Requirements
Bachelor/ Diploma in a relevant design discipline or the equivalent.
Minimum 1-3 years’ experience in graphic design with a strong portfolio of design work that demonstrates creative thinking, problem solving and technical understanding across a range of mediums.
Passionate about your work and our products.
Creative with a flair for art direction and a good eye for layout and typography.
Strong problem solving skills: Ability to understand, analyze and work through a challenge to completion.
High technical proficiency and expertise in Adobe suite programs (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign).
Deep understanding of all major Social Media platforms (dimensions, consumer behavior, theme overhauls, etc.) - Facebook, Instagram and Google advertising, Twitter, TikTok
Sharp eye for color correction, photo composition and retouching photography to a high standard.
Responsible and self-motivated, resourceful in making the impossible possible.
Ability to manage multiple projects with tight deadlines while operating in a demanding and fast-paced environment.
Bonuses
Experience with understanding photography lighting and digitally recreating them in product images for better synergy with photo specialists.
Experience with working with 3D softwares (Blender, C4D) or Video software (After Effects, Premiere Pro) to communicate with our 3D team and video specialists.
Interest in the consumer tech/gaming/esports industry

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Established in 1973 with headquarters in Seoul, South Korea, Cheil Worldwide is one of the world’s leading integrated marketing communications networks, with more than 6,800 employees globally in more than 54 offices in 46 countries. For more information, visit us at: www.cheil.com.

Cheil is expanding and we are inviting candidates to join our new and growing data-driven marketing solutions team. Reporting to the Digital Platform Director, we are looking for candidates for the following position:

UI Designer

Job Description

We are looking for an experienced and talented UI designer to translate strategic direction into high-quality, appealing and feel good designs for both web and mobile products. This candidate should also help drive the innovation of visual design and the improvement of user experience.

Job Responsibilities

· Optimise existing user interface designs for desktop and mobile
· Design assets or images to make opportunities tangible for various audiences
· Develop choices around design and user interfaces that allow cross-discipline teams to solve customer pain points and challenges
· Translate strategic direction into high-quality design within an established brand identity
· Create overall concepts for the user experience within a webpage or product, ensuring all interactions are intuitive and easy for customers
· Develop concepts, graphics and layouts, including making decisions about fonts, images, visual aesthetics and users’ needs
· Active involvement in workshops, research and testing sessions with stakeholders
· Conduct UX research and give recommendations both in written and visual (wireframe) for Test concepts, perform task and user analysis, and assist with user acceptance testing
· Develop prototypes that illustrate hierarchy, navigation and interaction
· Strategize and drive interactive product development from site map to launch
· Create compelling online consumer experience that drive business results
· Take a data driven user-cantered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.
· Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.
· Ask smart questions, take risks and champion new ideas.

Job Requirements

· Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in UI and Graphic Design
· Exceptional creativity and innovation, with problem solving mindset
· Portfolio of work with a wide range of creative projects with strong visual designs
· Deep Knowledge of layouts, graphic fundamentals, typography, print, and web
· Advanced skills in Figma / Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Fireworks)
· Expert understanding of IA architecture, workflows, concept development and interaction
· Ability to clearly and effectively communicate design processes, ideas, and solutions to the team
· Accuracy and attention to detail
· Strong analytical skills preferred
· Ability to work effectively in a team setting including synthesising abstract ideas into concrete visualisations
· Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism

title: Fashion creative graphic design and content creator
company_info: Pearly Lustre is a Singapore-based brand specialist in pearls. Historically, pearls were reserved for only those of royalty or the wealthy and always have had a longstanding status of luxury. However, pearl jewelry has been moving away from its traditional associations and growing into a fashion choice of modern sensibility. At Pearly Lustre, we believe the luminous sheen and rich lustre of the pearl should not be limited by age and class, and is a precious gem that can be sustainably crafted and fashioned into beautiful, imaginative pieces that represent every special moment in your life. "Every Pearl is a treasure nurtured by birth from Nature." Pearly Lustre appreciates the natural beauty of life. Our products are born from the thoughts of love and best wishes to the pair of hands that receive this most precious gem. This is reflected in the way we treat and treasure each and every pearl from the beginning to the end of the design process. Our design centre in Singapore houses our best specialists, who actively participate in acclaimed fashion shows and exhibitions globally, from Milan, Paris, Seoul, Shanghai to New York, bringing the latest fashion trends and designs to the forefront of our retail. We provide a customised service for all customers as well, from the selection of various grades of pearls, to personalised designs, material selections and high quality craftsmanship. — Pearls are only produced by oysters in unpolluted, pristine water. Even the slightest levels of pollutants will prevent proper pearl production. That's why we embrace sustainability at every stage in Pearly Lustre, from pearl sourcing to the aftercare of our products, so the beauty of our jewelry and accessories can be preserved for ages to come.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities

2. AutoCAD 2D/3D MAX technical drawings drafting skills (Intermediate level)
3. Knowledge in print production job flow, digital print terminology and various printing mediums is essential.
4. Processing and troubleshoot digital files received from clients and in-house designers for fonts, images, colour corrections, resolution and printability and convert to TIFF format print-ready status for both digital and offset printing by outsourced vendors.

6. Able to prepare technical construction drawings including schematic layout plans, elevations, and cross-sections.
7. Convert 3D drawings into AutoCAD drawings for carpentry fabrication.
8. Knowledge in preparing CAD output files for CNC Router wood cutting and routing is a plus.
9. Relevant working experience in digital printing industries or event props production companies is a plus.

title: Desktop Graphic cum CAD Technician
company_info: Established in 2013, Icatcher Productions is the partner of choice for one-stop events support services that delivers high quality services with superior workmanship for our clients. Our specialty in conceptualisation, planning, design, fabrication and professional installation services have been achieved with a robust team of experienced talents, carpenters, designers and installation specialists. We strive to deliver and transform creative concepts and ideas into reality that exceed all expectations with great immersive experience for clients and guests attending experiential events and shows. Our main core of business activities involves design, construction and installation of events props and fixtures including turnkey events venue set-up. Specialties comprising of conference and seminar backdrop, exhibition stands, roadshow display booths, festive decorations, customised props, electrical and mechanical launch mechanism, light boxes, standees and entrance arch structures. We are also capable of providing event props support services and set up in overseas events covering Malaysia, Thailand, Vietnam, Indonesia and Japan. We have in-house carpentry workshops situated in Singapore and Malaysia Johor Bahru as well as steel fabrication factory under our sister company Sin Lee Heng Iron Works Awning Pte Ltd. Through the years, our dedicated team have worked closely with numerous clients across various industries including marketing and advertising agencies, show planners, event management companies, tradeshows organisers and hotel event managers. You will be working with a Young and Fast-Growing Company that actively striving to expand business outreach in the MICE and Events Industry. We welcome you to join our Team!

title: Senior Designer
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
ABOUT THE ROLE
As part of the Spa Esprit Group creative team, the Senior Graphic Designer has the talent, passion, and
experience to deliver creative graphic design solutions, user experience, and storytelling for our brands for
both outbound marketing and internal corporate branding. The ideal candidate will be self-driven,
detail-oriented, articulate, innovative, and imaginative with exceptional design, interpersonal,
communication, and project management skills, and will be responsible for developing and maintaining our
visual language across a variety of online and offline materials. This position reports directly to our Creative
Lead for Tiong Bahru Bakery.

ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
● You are passionate about ideating, executing and defining creative ideas, working across branding,
packaging and brand experience.
● Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment and be comfortable with constant changes
and ambiguity.
● Assist the Creative Lead to set the standard for craft for the brand.
● Ability to present and clearly communicate the creative vision and business strategy behind
concepts in a coherent, confident, and inspiring manner.
● Present all stages of the design process directly to the creative and marketing team.

QUALIFICATIONS
● You possess a creative mindset. You have a keen eye for creativity and are able to think outside the
box to develop innovative ideas and storytelling that help set our company/brand apart.
● You're a brand guardian. You are passionate about maintaining brand consistency and ensuring that
our brand's values and messaging are reflected in all external communications.
● You're a relationship builder. You're not only great at building and nurturing relationships with cross
departments, but also at effectively navigating challenging situations with internal cross-functional
teams as well as external vendors.
● You embody a mission-driven mindset. You think strategically when driving results, dedicated to
achieving measurable outcomes, and approach your role with a sense of ownership and
accountability.
● You're down-to-earth and willing to wear multiple hats and roll up your sleeves to tackle tasks.
● Not limited to your roles and responsibilities, you have the ability to think out of the box,
consistently bringing fresh perspectives and creative ideas to the table.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
● Minimum of 7 years’ experience leading in design and execution.
● A strong portfolio that demonstrates design mastery: creative excellence, storytelling, problem
solving and technical understanding.
● Strong project management skills, ability to lead multiple initiatives and handle complexity with
confidence. Proven field, outstanding time management skills, ability to set priorities and be
accountable from concept to final design execution with excellence.
● Outstanding communication skills, written, verbal and visual, with the ability to justify your
conceptional and directional design choices.
● Software fluency in Adobe CS (Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign) Proficiency with video editing and/or
animation is a plus.
● Proficient English required - written and oral communication skills.

We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for
employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression,
pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other
characteristic protected by law.

Conceptualize and create impactful, fresh, progressive, and commercially appealing original graphics, artworks, and pattern designs to be used for Home Textile Department.

We are dedicated to fostering a family-friendly culture and work environment. title: Cluster Design & Social Media Executive
company_info: HOLIDAY INN SINGAPORE LITTLE INDIA Located right on top of Farrer Park MRT Station, the hotel is situated amidst a backdrop of the district’s vibrant enclave; where bountiful sights and sounds within this ethnic community thrive. Standing tall amongst surrounding shopping complexes, quaint restaurants and historical shop houses, the 20-storey hotel with its sleek glass exteriors offers panoramic views of the vibrant district, and is a stone's throw to the Central Business District. With a mix of 300 contemporary guest rooms, coupled with modern amenities, Holiday Inn Singapore Little India also features two dining outlets, a swimming pool and gymnasium ideal for business travel or family holidays.
address: Holiday Inn Singapore Little India, 10 Farrer Park Station Road 217564
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us
At Holiday Inn® Hotels & Resorts, our job is to bring the joy of travel to everyone. That’s where you come in. When you’re part of the Holiday Inn Hotels & Resorts brand, you’re more than just a job title.
At Holiday Inn, we look for people who are friendly, welcoming and full of life; people who are always finding ways to make every guest’s experience an enjoyable one.
As the Cluster Design & Social Media Executive for Holiday Inn Singapore Little India & Holiday Inn Express Singapore Clarke Quay, you are responsible for creating impact with a creative social-first approach. With an eye for design, you will be developing and executing the brand’s visual identity for online and offline marketing to drive a consistent brand experience and cultivate brand loyalty.
Reports to the Cluster Marketing & PR Manager. Interacts with guests and individuals, including but not limited to current and potential clients, owning company representatives, suppliers, competitors and other members of the local community

Your day to day
Design & Creative
Conceptualize, visualize and execute creative and design development for both offline and online marketing to deliver a compelling brand story.
Custodian of brand standards across two distinctive brand identity, ensuring marketing collaterals are reflective of standards while conducting frequent audits and content hygiene maintenance.
Management and execution of photoshoot and video shoot projects from pre to post production.
Social Media
Develop eye-catching visual assets to support monthly social media content calendar with support from the wider Marketing Team.
Ensure timely and accurate tracking of marketing expenses.
Others
Strengthen customer relationships through social and earned media, monitoring both hotel, R&Bs and competitors’ presence on social media for performance enhancement.
Work closely with Marketing & PR Manager and others within the greater Marketing team with marketing activities and utilizes best practices to provide a consistent brand experience and cultivate brand loyalty.
Provide guidance and learning growth to Marketing Intern on all social and designing functions by translating initiatives into clear actions and forge strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.

What we need from you
Preferred 1 – 2 years of experience of marketing experience in handling graphic designing and social media role. Bachelor’s degree in marketing is preferred. Graduate degree in a related field is desirable.
Familiar with social media landscape and digital marketing channels/tools.
Demonstrated experience in art directing, collaterals conceptualization and designing.
Basic knowledge of editing programs and tools. Programs include, but not limited to Adobe Software.
Strong linguist with effective English and Chinese literacy.
Problem solver at heart with a can-do attitude, who can navigate through ambiguity.

What we Offer
In return for your hard work, you can look forward to a highly competitive salary and benefits package – including:
• Duty meals
• Birthday Leave on your birthday month
• Monthly LOVE Hour
• Extensive coverage of Medical, dental & optical benefits
• Insurance Coverage
• F&B Discount at restaurants within IHG Singapore Hotels
• Special Employee Rate at all IHG Hotels worldwide
• Room to Grow opportunities

What’s more, because your career will be as unique as you are, we’ll give you all the tailored support you need to make a great start, be involved and grow. And because the Holiday Inn Hotels & Resorts brand belongs to the IHG® family of brands, you’ll also benefit from all of the opportunities that come from being part of a successful, global hospitality company with over 6,000 hotels in over 100 countries around the world. So whoever you are, whatever you love doing, bring your passion to Holiday Inn and IHG and we’ll make sure you’ll have Room to be yourself. Find out more about joining us today by going to careers.ihg.com.

title: Regional Design Technology Lead - Computation
company_info: GENSLER SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. Gensler is a global architecture, design, planning, and strategic consulting firm that specializes in a wide range of building and facilities owned or used by businesses, institutions, and public agencies. Our services engage the full building cycle from initial planning through design, implementation, and management. We focus on our clients, understand their goals and strategies, and seek to add substantial value to their enterprise through our work and services. Gensler was founded in San Francisco in 1965. To ensure close interaction with its clients, the firm has grown from one office to a broad-based organization with 46 locations and a professional resource in excess of 5,000 people. Gensler Singapore Pte Ltd was established in July 2009 to be the strategic hub of Southeast Asia and is expected to grow into it base for the firm’s activities. Gensler’s wide service offering is appropriate for the Asia region where projects` needs are incredibly diverse and the local resource availability equally broad. Currently our Asia offices include Beijing, Shanghai, Tokyo, Hong Kong, Bangalore, Singapore, and Bangkok, each of them passionately delivers designs for projects of widely diverse scale and scope to both our global and regional clients. Why Join Us? At Gensler, people are our greatest asset. We are a constellation of many stars. Each of our team members represents the best talent within their discipline, bringing a unique point of view to the table. We are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive workforce. As a global firm, we come from a multitude of backgrounds, and we value a variety of ideas and perspectives. As interior designers, product designers, architects, graphic designers, Web designers, urban designers, master planners, brand strategists, real estate consultants, information management experts, accountants, marketers, human resource professionals and more, we are committed to Gensler’s vision of making great design work for our clients and communities around the globe. The way we see it, a successful business is built on the leadership, design excellence and visionary outlook of successful people. We encourage and help you to develop and refine your skills, because we’re as invested in building careers as projects. Gensler is a winner of the 2009 Workforce Management Optimas Award, the 2009 Chief Learning Officer Learning Team Silver Award, and the 2010-2013 AIA IDP Outstanding Firm Award. We rank among Training Magazine's "125 Top Training Firms" and Building Design + Construction's "Best AEC Firms to Work For."
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
At Gensler, we design for people. We leverage our global perspective and local presence to innovate at every scale. We’re not just designers. We’re tinkerers, craftspeople, visionaries, innovators and thought leaders. Fueled by passion and entrepreneurial spirit, our people bring new ideas to solve challenging problems. Whether you’re into sketching new ideas, hacking a building or growing client relationships in global markets, there’s something here for everyone.
Our depth of expertise spans disciplines—from aviation and transportation to education, hospitality, retail, technology and more. At our core we embody an entrepreneurial spirit, always looking ahead for new ways to innovate and add to our clients' success. We share the belief that design has the power to transform organizations and change lives; whether we’re refreshing a retailer’s brand, planning a new urban district or designing a super tall building.
Our work reflects an enduring commitment to sustainability, and we believe that a diversity of voices and cultures is one of the most powerful strategic tools for securing lasting competitive advantage.
As the world’s largest design firm, Gensler has a unique obligation and opportunity to focus on sustainability in the built environment. We deepened our commitment to combat the impact on climate change in the built environment when we launched Gensler Cities Climate Challenge (GC3) in 2019. This is our pledge to meet an ambitious goal: the elimination of all greenhouse gases from our work by 2030.
Your Role
You are a developer with a passion and experience in delivering production code in the Design/Architecture industry.  You can deliver high-quality code that is modular and extensible by your colleagues because it’s human readable, well-commented, and thoughtfully architected. You are comfortable writing code that can interact with the application and display layers.  You have a passion for code clarity, extensibility, and scalability. You have a deep understanding of BIM modeling and associated challenges. You are open to learning and enjoy teaching what you know. You are purpose-driven and want to be part of a unique design technology team at an organization with amazing global impact.
Essential:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering and / or architecture or equivalent years of experience
Deep knowledge of computational geometry (topology optimization, medial axis, point clouds, rationalization, panelization, Delaunay meshes, etc)
Deep knowledge of and proven practical experience in Computational Design applications such as Grasshopper, Dynamo etc.
Experience with Performance Design applications such as Radiance, Energy+, OpenFoam, Ladybug Tools, Diva etc.
Experience/ability to build and deploy Grasshopper/Dynamo scripts & plugins
High level of proficiency in C#, Python or pyRevit
Good knowledge of RhinoCommon, RhinoCompute, Grasshopper SDKs, and Revit API
Deep understanding of software interoperability routines
Comfortable working with JSON and XML data formats
Experience/ability with custom UI at the application level
Comfortable working with using Git + source control in a team environment
Good code hygiene and DRY approach
Good graphic design and storytelling skills
Desirable:
Experience in building Web based frontend UIs using Javascript frameworks like VueJs/ReactJs
Experience in building Rest/GraphQL APIs using Go/NodeJs/C#/Python
Experience in working with OpenGL layer and display namespaces
Experience with UI/UX development process
Experience in PowerBI/Tableau or other Data Visualization tools
Bonus:
Experience in Tensorflow, pix2pix or other Machine Learning/AI frameworks
Fair understanding of UNIX and container / cluster computing technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
Working knowledge of the Forge SDK
Experience working with game development engines like Unity, Unreal
Experience in various methodologies to produce AR/VR/MR visualization outputs
To be considered, please submit portfolio and/or work samples in PDF format.
Life at Gensler
Gensler Asia-Pacific and Middle East is committed to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion through our Five Strategies. In partnership with our clients, we strive to create a just and equitable future for our communities and our colleagues. We celebrate our diversity and are focused on creating an inclusive workplace environment for all.
As a people-first organization, we are as committed to enjoying life as we are to delivering best-in-class design. From internal design competitions to research grants to “Well-being Week,” our offices reflect our people’s diverse interests.
We encourage every person at Gensler to lead a healthy and balanced life. Our comprehensive benefits include medical, dental, vision, disability and wellness programs. We also offer profit sharing and twice annual bonus opportunities.
As part of the firm’s commitment to licensure and professional development, Gensler offers reimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam fees. In addition, we reimburse tuition for certain eligible programs or classes. We view our professional development programs as strategic investments in our future.

title: Graphic Designer / Senior Graphic Designer
company: PAN PACIFIC RETAIL MANAGEMENT (SINGAPORE) PTE. LTD.
company_info: Don Quijote, a Japanese discount retail chain famously known as “Donki”, is expanding to Southeast Asia as Don Don Donki. Don Quijote Group's holding company for overseas operations, Pan Pacific International Holdings Pte. Ltd. (PPIH) based in Singapore, will develop the Don Don Donki stores for Southeast Asia. To date, PPIH has opened two Don Don Donki stores in Singapore and Thailand will be open by end of 2018. PPIH targets to open at least 10 more stores by 2020. The Don Quijote Group was established in 1980 and opened its first Don Quijote general discount store in 1989. It has since steadily expanded its business and its network of stores by developing a unique type of business based on its store concept of providing “convenience,” “discount” and “amusement,” and by pursuing mergers and acquisitions.
description:

title: Junior Graphic Designer
company_info: Founded in 1997, Singapore’s award-winning microbrewery restaurant, Brewerkz Restaurant & Microbrewery, was the brain-child of US-born Devin Otto Kimble (on the right) and Daniel Flores, who initially modeled it after similar concepts in the USA and Canada. The iconic full-service restaurant features high quality American-style food and a full range of premium beers handcrafted on-site from the 10 hl microbrewery attached to the restaurant. Most notable attraction of the restaurant is the distinctly featured custom-made microbrewery built by Newlands Systems Inc in Abbotsford, BC Canada. Equipped with specially fabricated fermentation tanks that have been designed to minimize floor-space needs, the brewing system produces over 2,500 hectoliters of beer per annum, nearly all of which is drunk at both Brewerkz locations, its sister restaurant Café Iguana and several other local watering holes restaurants in Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description
Join us in an exciting phase of growth and expansion at The Brewerkz Group!
As a Junior Graphic Designer, your primary focus will be on enhancing the digital visual identity of the Brewerkz and Café Iguana brands within The Brewerkz Group, while also actively supporting the team in creative adaptations. Brewerkz is a multi-award-winning craft brewery with five thriving restaurants in Singapore, recognised as a Made with Passion brand and celebrated as Singapore’s longest-running craft brewery experience. Café Iguana serves modern Mexican food and is a pioneer of the Mexican food scene in Singapore.
Our portfolio of brands is in a state of dynamic expansion, and as part of this exciting growth, we are thrilled to introduce an up-and-coming F&B brand. Although we can't reveal all the details just yet, rest assured it's a venture brimming with potential.
As a Junior Graphic Designer who is spirited and self-driven, and who shares our passion for the F&B industry, this role opens doors to a diverse range of responsibilities. Your journey will encompass absorbing learning experiences, engaging with a variety of tasks, and collaborating closely with our exciting partner brands. Notably, you will also enjoy the distinctive privilege of working in direct collaboration with business owners, contributing wholeheartedly to our collective expansion.
Responsibilities
This role will report to the Art Director and provide essential support in content development, with a primary emphasis on the digital landscape. Your role will be crucial in enhancing our digital presence and maintaining a consistent visual identity across platforms.
The major responsibilities of this role include:
Working closely with the marketing team to design and create marketing collateral
Developing and updating existing artwork, including but not limited to promotional materials, menu updates, and printed display materials
Contribute to and propose creative concepts for brands, product/ services, and campaigns
Assisting in food photography (bonus if you are able to handle DSLR and perform photography)
Ensure accuracy and proper execution of artwork within deadlines
Liaising with vendors for quotation and delivery of printed materials
Provide ad-hoc administrative duties to support creative activities and projects
Identifying and staying up-to-date with digital and social media trends, and proposing appropriate actions to increase brand awareness and customer engagement
Requirement:
Candidate must possess at least Diploma/Degree in Graphic Design/ Media Design
At least 2 years’ of relevant working experience
Proficient in Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, After Effects and Premiere Pro is essential
Ability to conceptualise, visualise and create media assets that are optimised for digital platforms
An excellent sense of visual design
Ability to work effectively both in a team and independently
Competency in multimedia skills, including video and audio editing is a bonus.
Competency in basic HTML coding, WordPress, BigCommerce, web programming is a bonus

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Us

LIKKA is a homegrown fashion brand that was started in July 2022. We are growing rapidly and is looking to expand the team as we move to our next phase of the company's growth. There’s a lot more work to be done with all of our exciting plans. If you are a creative individual with a passion for fashion and video content creation, as well as experience in influencer marketing, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.
You can find us on likka.sg

Responsibilities
Produce and create short video content for Instagram and TikTok including ideation, shooting and editing
Coordinate and execute marketing campaigns through EDMs, social media platforms and web
Identify and research potential influencers who align with our brand and target audience.
Negotiate compensation and terms with influencers, and manage influencer collaborations from start to finish.
Graphic design and video editing

Market level internship salary
Hybrid working environment

title: Graphic Designer
company_info: All about Crown Coffee We combine Robotics, Artificial Intelligence, IoT and Data Analytics to enhance customer journey and experience for our clients and in the process making it an immersive and fun experience. We love technology and our goal is to make everything connected and smart right where people need it the most! We are Experience Integrator. Pioneering a technology-led concept that combines traditional Roman coffee served up through mobile coffee carts operated by Ella the Robotic Barista, Crown Coffee finds newer, smarter ways to bring great coffee to you. Crown Coffee is the sole importer of Buscaglione Coffee, a high-quality espresso from a modern roastery in Rome, Italy. Crown Group’s domain expertise in retail and key strengths in customer experience and automation, has put it in a position to become an IoT (Internet of Things) and digitalisation evangelist. Our mission is to digitalise traditional businesses through the use of cloud computing, facial recognition, data analytics, and artificial intelligence, to build intelligent systems for brick and mortar businesses to thrive in this digitalised world. And while we’re doing it, also to put a great cup of coffee in every hand.

title: Senior / Creative Designer
company_info: I Concept is a creative and technology agency specialized in making brands phenomenal. I Concept works with clients to give consumers something worth talking about—brand content that sparks emotion, that adds value, and inspires action. By doing this, we’re helping clients connect consumer-led brand conversations to meaningful business results via multiple effective marketing channels.
address: AZ @ PAYA LEBAR, 140 PAYA LEBAR ROAD 409015
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Description
As an Senior/Creative Designer (Please let us know the role you are applying for, salary will commensurate with experience), you will be working together in a team to conceptualise and execute creative deliverables for any given project. Together with the suits, copywriters and programmers, you work to establish key objectives and unpack the brief. You will develop a sound concept across different marketing touchpoints (both physical and digital where required). In the absence of a clear definitive direction, your inspirations could also pave way for the others to bounce their ideas off.
From creative concepts, branding, social media marketing, ecommerce design to UI/UX, you’ve got to have a good grasp of their fundamentals and all things in between.

Job Scope
Unpack and study creative briefs and understand requirements
Concept development and conceptualisation of ideas for creative concepts, branding and marketing campaigns (including various ATL and BTL collaterals such as brochures, posters, standees, social media, web banners, eDMs, etc...) with rationales
Develop brand strategies, identities and the various touchpoints
Create creative designs that are on-brand, effective and aesthetically appealing
Digital retouching and image editing
Create website designs and their prototypes
Lead and work as part of a multidisciplinary team
Job Requirements
Diploma or Degree in Communication Design, Fine Arts or related field
Proven creative design experience
Demonstrable graphic design skills with a strong portfolio
Solid experience in ideating concepts, storyboards, wireframes, user flows, process flows and site maps
Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign, Figma, After Effects, or other visual design and wire-framing tools
Have a keen eye for details
Excellent communication skills to clearly articulate concept ideas, designs and rationales
Strong team player and able to collaborate effectively with key team members
Able to work methodically and meet deadlines
Excellent visual design skills with sensitivity to user-system interaction
Ability to solve problems creatively and effectively
Up-to-date with the latest Web trends, techniques and technologies
Non-smoker preferred
This role is ideal for a candidate who is comfortable working in a hybrid environment and who is able to collaborate effectively with team members both in the office and remotely. We work-from-home on Mondays and Fridays, and in the office on Tuesdays to Thursdays.

Agency's selling points
A supportive culture and environment that nurtures creative thinking
Hybrid work schedule
Collaborative work environment
Prominent player with various expertise in the digital sphere
Opportunities for growth and development
To apply, please send your application with your CV, portfolio and education certificates from secondary school onwards to melissa@iconceptdigital.com﻿, thank you.

providing strategic leadership, day to day management, motivation and
inspiration. You build strategic and profitable relationships with clients
with a view to growing selected accounts.

And to be a really great Design Director at Elmwood you’ll employ these
attributes in abundance to get the job done:
- strategic thinking
- ability to effectively brief, lead and motivate teams
- great with and in front of clients
- able to challenge in the right way
- managing the work around you to contribute to an amazing pipeline
of creative award entries

The Role in Detail:

Delivery
- You’re the running mate for the Client Partner and Account
Director, understanding the strategic needs of the client.
- Lead the team on high value projects, demonstrating exceptional
creativity, intellect, strategic thinking and effectiveness to
problem solving.
- You’re a multi-tasker and can juggle multiple projects ensuring
you’re hitting the brief every time.
- Actively reviewing the team’s delivery and resource management
to achieve the creative and commercial outcomes by using
effective problem solving and decision making.
- Being respected in your field of expertise, and capable of leading
strategic discussions.
- You proactively support the Creative Director in the delivery of
award winning creative work.
- Instrumental in the creation of high quality awards entry
material including imagery and the project story.
- You ensure that work you are responsible for is captured in a way
suitable for case studies ie. keynote and web usage.

Relationships
- Develop strong and beneficial relationships with key
stakeholders including clients, suppliers and within industry
networks.
- You play an active part in sustaining Elmwood’s reputation as a
world class Design Agency through effective management,
marketing, networking and PR of the studio, both internally and
externally.
- You need to build effective teams, empowering them to perform
not only for the client, but also to achieve their own objectives.
- Maximising the creative output on projects looking beyond the
brief through directing and coaching, providing constructive,
honest feedback to build confidence.
- Identify development opportunities for your direct reports and
more junior colleagues in the Design team to support the growth
and retention of our talent.
- You actively and energetically support the Creative Director in
creating a positive and successful place to work, encouraging
learning, competition and teamwork.

Commercials
- Showing commercial leadership and doing what is right for
Elmwood through effective strategies, standards and behaviours.
- Effectively leading multiple projects with a view to expanding
project scope and creating further revenue opportunities.
- Keeping abreast of industry insights, seeking new opportunities
and revenue streams to develop Elmwood’s offering.

Thinking broader
- Continual learning about our systems, processes and insights.
- Constructively participating in the development and delivery of
the creative strategy of the studio strategy to build our creative and
commercial reputation.
- Developing and delivering one presentation as part of Elmwood’s
L&D internal program.

Skills and Expertise
What we’re looking for in a great Design Director
- Qualification in graphic design to degree level or equivalent.
- A book that demonstrates exceptional creativity, intellect, craft skills
and preferably award winning work.
- A strategic thinker when it comes to brands.
- Ability to delivery work to achieve revenue targets.
- Proven commercial success in farming existing and winning new pieces
of work.
- An awareness of different print and production techniques.
- Regular presenter/speaker at industry events.
- An active networker.
- An ability to lead and inspire others and to get the most out of those
around - you are a natural collaborator.

title: Senior UI / UX Designer
company_info: RegASK is a global RegTech company provides regulatory consulting services by leveraging their in-house AI based platform capability combined with regulatory team expertise for devising path-to market, path to claim, market expansion etc. strategies for FMCG, MedTech, Pharma companies across the globe. RegASK was newly created by the founders of SPRIM, after more than 17 years of consulting on globalization projects and researching regulatory guidelines for healthcare companies across six of the seven continents. RegASK is backed by a team of regulatory experts with a global perspective and years of navigating some of the most complicated regulatory hurdles in markets big and small.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
OUR COMPANY
We, at RegASK are a high growth global RegTech company leveraging technology and global network of experts to revolutionize regulatory intelligence, serving the LifeSciences (MedTech, CROs, Pharma) and FMCG industries (Food, Personal Care). RegASK team is highly diverse with more than 10 nationalities across 3 continents, entrepreneurial and very agile, enjoying the benefits of working across industries and across the globe. RegASK just completed its series A Funding round in December 2022 and is currently recruiting highly motivated talents to expand its team and support its ambitious growth plans.

RegASK is an international, diverse and rewarding place to work. If you are a builder, highly autonomous in your working style, and eager to problem solve, we would love to hear from you.

RegASK is part of Sprim Globa Investments portfolio, a group of 500+ people in 19 offices across 6 continents, finding solutions, discovering and implementing new ideas to deliver better health.

THE POSITION
Senior UI/UX Designer

As a Senior UI/UX Designer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the visual and interactive aspects of our digital products. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to translate user needs and business objectives into intuitive and visually appealing user interfaces. Your expertise will contribute to enhancing user satisfaction, engagement, and brand perception.
Key Responsibilities:
Collaborate with product managers, developers, and stakeholders to understand project goals, user requirements, and technical constraints.
Create wireframes, user flows, and prototypes that effectively communicate design ideas and interaction concepts.
Design visually engaging and intuitive user interfaces for web and mobile applications.
Develop and maintain design guidelines, style guides, and UI pattern libraries to ensure consistency across projects.
Conduct user research, usability testing, and gather feedback to iterate and improve designs.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in UI/UX design.
Mentor and provide guidance to junior designers, sharing your knowledge and fostering skill growth.
Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Interaction Design, HCI, or related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) as a UI/UX Designer or similar role, preferably in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Strong portfolio showcasing a range of UI/UX design projects across various platforms.
Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, InVision, etc.
Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and interaction design best practices.
Ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and communicate design rationale.
Experience with responsive design, mobile app design, and a good understanding of front-end development principles.
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to iterate designs based on feedback.
Excellent attention to detail and a passion for creating exceptional user experiences.
Up-to-date knowledge of accessibility standards and guidelines is a plus.
How to Apply:
If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and qualifications to excel as our Senior UI/UX Designer, please submit your resume and a cover letter explaining why you are the ideal candidate for the role.
We appreciate all applications, but only selected candidates will be contacted for an interview.
Thank you for considering joining the RegASK team. We look forward to reviewing your application!

title: GRAPHIC DESIGNER
company_info: Brand Story Back in 1998 we decided we would give the boot to fancy French pastries (which were concoctions of everything but cake) that had invaded Singapore and bring the humble cake back to its glory days. We resolved to put the cake back into cake and we would make it chocolate. It was a simple resolve and we didn’t want to complicate it. So we started a cake shop selling only one cake – a simple dark chocolate cake between layers of dark chocolate fudge. Real cake one could bite into, rich in taste yet moist and light. Not just mouthfuls of mousse or cream. Not overly sweet but something you would find yourself craving for regularly and never tire of. Since then Awfully Chocolate has grown from a one cake shop in Katong into a group of shops, cafes and restaurants bearing our love for dark chocolate, both in Singapore and overseas.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview:
We are seeking a detail-oriented and motivated Visual Content Assistant Project Manager (Graphics Design) to join our creative team. In this role, your main job responsibility will be to lead and manage a team of project coordinators and graphic designers under the guidance of the Art Director. Additionally, you will be responsible for photography and videography vendor management, negotiations, and collaboration to ensure the successful execution of visual content projects.

Key Responsibilities:
1. Team Leadership and Management:
Lead and manage a team of project coordinators and graphic designers, fostering a positive and collaborative work environment.
Provide guidance, mentorship, and professional development opportunities to team members, empowering them to excel in their roles.
2. Photography and Videography Vendor Management:
Source, negotiate with, and manage photography and videography vendors to ensure the availability of high-quality visual assets for projects.
Collaborate with vendors to meet project requirements and ensure timely delivery of visual content.
3. Project Coordination:
Assist the Art Director in planning, organising, and executing graphics design projects from concept to completion.
Collaborate with graphic designers, content creators, and other stakeholders to gather project requirements and ensure successful delivery of visual content.
4. Graphics Design Management:
Work closely with graphic designers to ensure that visual assets align with project objectives, brand guidelines, and quality standards.
Provide feedback and guidance to the design team to maintain consistency and excellence in visual content.
5. Timelines and Milestones:
Support the Art Director in establishing project timelines, milestones, and budgets.
Monitor project progress and communicate updates to the Art Director and project team to ensure adherence to deadlines.
6. Team Collaboration:
Foster a collaborative and productive team environment, promoting creative thinking and effective communication.
Coordinate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of visual content within larger projects.
7. Quality Control and Review:
Conduct thorough reviews of graphic design work to ensure it aligns with project briefs and meets quality standards.
Collaborate with the design team to address any necessary revisions or improvements.

Requirements:
1. Education and Experience:
A Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Graphic Design, Visual Communication, or a related field is a plus.
Proven experience in team leadership, project coordination, or graphics design in a creative environment.
2. Skills and Abilities:
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple design projects and a team of project coordinators simultaneously.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate effectively with designers, project coordinators, stakeholders, and vendors.
Proficiency in design software and tools to review and provide input on design work.
3. Creativity and Design Knowledge:
Creative eye and understanding of design principles to provide constructive feedback and ensure high-quality visual content.
4. Team Collaboration:
Ability to work well in a team, lead and support project coordinators, and coordinate team efforts.

If you are passionate about graphics design, project coordination, team leadership, and vendor management and want to work closely with the Art Director, join our Brand Visual team as a Visual Content Assistant Project Manager (Graphics Design). Your expertise in managing a team of project coordinators and designers, as well as your ability to collaborate with vendors for photography and videography, will be instrumental in achieving artistic excellence and delivering captivating visual content.

title: Social Media & Graphic Design Executive - Full Time
company_info: The Marina Central Business Improvement District (BID) is a non-profit organisation that is committed to support businesses to thrive in this district, build a community for common good and enliven the spaces in the location. The stakeholders are Marina Square, Millenia Singapore, South Beach and Suntec City, with Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay as a community partner. The district is positioned as a premium iconic destination that is home to a variety of business and leisure offerings. With its offices, retail and food and beverage options, Marina Central represents a convergence of communities and passions, as well as a shared space for all to come together and enjoy. Marina Central is part of the Urban Redevelopment Authority’s (URA) pilot Business Improvement District programme which encourages active place management efforts by stakeholders in a district. Marina Central is supported by the government in its efforts to take a more active role in enlivening the district and improving visitor experience, thereby enhancing the attractiveness and distinctiveness of Singapore.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Company overview:
The Marina Central Business Improvement District (BID) is a non-profit organisation committed to support businesses in the district by fostering a community for common good and enliven the spaces in the district. It is an initiative under Urban Redevelopment Authority’s (URA) pilot Business Improvement District programme. The stakeholders of Marina Central BID are Marina Square, Millenia Singapore, South Beach and Suntec City, with Esplanade – Theatres on the Bay as a community partner.

Job overview:
The Social Media and Graphic Design Executive is responsible for the curation, coordination and creation of Marina Central’s social media, and for designing marketing collaterals for the district.

Working together with the Assistant Manager, the candidate should be trained in graphic design and be proactive in conceptualising and creating content to promote Marina Central district. An aptitude in copywriting will be beneficial.

Key responsibilities include:
• Curate, plan, coordinate and publish content for Marina Central social media platforms using Meta Business Suite
• Create graphics and videos for social media platforms

title: Creative Designer
company_info: Since our inception in 1998, Agape Communications’ core philosophy has led us into the new decade as a strategy-led creative brand agency that aims to bridge the gap between consulting and creating, while keeping our focus on our clients’ growth in the post-COVID landscape. Creatives never stop thinking, and good ideas never stay still. Strategic Thinking We think, a lot. Our strategy is focused on deriving insights, data analysis and knowledge inquiry so that we can make farsighted decisions and effective executions. Boldness We keep up with the times. Our swift responses and daring approach to new ideas and contexts mean we are not afraid to take risks and express ourselves. Perspective & Insight We are multifaceted. Every individual in Agape brings fresh and unique perspectives to the table every day, so that there is never a moment where any of us sees the same idea in the same way.
job_category: Advertising / Media, Consulting, Design, Events / Promotions, Marketing / Public Relations
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
At Agape, good ideas never stay still.
Since our inception in 1998, Agape Communications’ core philosophy has led us into the new decade as a strategy-led creative brand agency that aims to bridge the gap between consulting and creating, while keeping our focus on our client’s growth in the post-COVID landscape. Creatives never stop thinking, and good ideas never stay still.

Strategic Thinking
We think, a lot. Our strategy is focused on deriving insights, data analysis and knowledge inquiry so that we can make farsighted decisions and effective executions.
Boldness
We keep up with the times. Our swift responses and daring approach to new ideas and contexts mean we are not afraid to take risks and express ourselves.
Perspective & Insight
We are multifaceted. Every individual in Agape brings fresh and unique perspectives to the table every day so that there is never a moment where we see the same idea in the same way.
Job Specification
Translate ideas and creativity into various media platforms such as brand identity, print/online ads, web design and illustration.
Responsible for accomplishing and maintaining the quality of design throughout all project phases.
Partake in other ad hoc back-end and front-end tasks as necessary.
Requirements
Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's Degree/Post-Graduate Diploma/Professional Degree in Art/Design/Creative Multimedia or equivalent.
At least 1 Year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position.
Possesses flair and creativity in graphic design or illustration. Preferably both.
Works effectively with limitations and client briefs.
Able to articulate ideas effectively either through visuals or speech.
Possesses fair knowledge of industry best practices and various media platforms.
Proficient in Adobe software including InDesign, Photoshop and Illustrator.
Some Nice to Haves
Web design capabilities and flair will be a huge plus.
Copywriting skills are a plus.
The successful candidate will have a solid creative flair and previous experience in a similar role.
However, we welcome you to write in if you are a new designer with a strong portfolio.
We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
